resources.string: %1$d. Driving is a repetition of three things. Which are they in correct order?
%1$d. Which of the following should be done continuously while driving a vehicle?
Adjusting vehicle controls for smooth running
Making a visual check for all controls
%1$d. You start to feel tired while driving. What should you do?
Stop at a safe place to rest
%1$d. While driving a car, a properly adjusted head restraint will
Help you to avoid neck injury
Help you to maintain your driving position
%1$d. You should only use a mobile phone when
The vehicle is stationary & parked suitably.
Reacting to wrong behaviour of other drivers.
Observing dash board gauges because this will affect your concentration.
%1$d. To help concentration on long journeys you should stop frequently and
%1$d. To drive on the road, learners must
Have only the registration certificate of the vehicle
Apply for a driving test within 12 months.
%1$d. Which of the following types of eye glasses should not be worn when driving at night?
%1$d. Objects hanging from your interior mirror may
Restrict your view & distract your attention
%1$d. What is the best way to prevent fatigue when driving?
Drink two pegs of good quality whisky
%1$d. Your overall stopping distance will be much longer when driving
%1$d. When driving at sunset or dawn on a dark day. What should you do?
Keep your sunglasses on to cut down headlight glare.
Turn on your lights on low beam.
Turn on your hazard warning lights.
%1$d. At road junctions which of the following are most vulnerable?
%1$d. In what situation are other drivers allowed to flash their headlights at you?
To warn you of their presence
To warn you danger is ahead
To warn you when you\'re breaking the speed limit
To tell you that they are giving way to you
%1$d. What is the best way to avoid hitting other vehicles, people or animals when moving off from the kerb?
Get out of the car, look around and quickly drive off.
Check your mirrors and look over your shoulder before moving off.
%1$d. Which of these statements is true?
Pedestrians have no special rights on the road
You must give right of way to pedestrians only on zebra crossings.
Pedestrians have right of way at uncontrolled pedestrian crossing
%1$d. When driving in wet weather you should
Drive in the middle of the road to avoid splashing water on pedestrians?
Watch out for pedestrians who may hurry and take risks.
Stop and help elderly people cross the road
%1$d. You must obey signs giving orders. These signs are mostly in
You may go straight on if there is no other traffic
You must stop behind white stop line
You may turn left if it is safe to do so
You must slow down and prepare to stop if traffic has started to cross.
%1$d. As a learning licence-holder you should not drive a vehicle
On the motorway without a permanent licence holder.
%1$d. On which of these occasions must you stop your vehicle?
When signaled to do so by a police officer
%1$d. Why should you make sure that you have cancelled your indicators after turning?
To avoid misleading other road users
To avoid dazzling other road users
To avoid damage to the indicator relay
%1$d. How much distance should you keep from a vehicle travelling in front of you?
Depends on the speed of the vehicle travelling in front of you
A distance sufficient to avoid collision if the vehicle in front of you suddenly slows down or stops
%1$d. You must not use your horn when you are stationary
Unless a moving vehicle may cause you danger
Unless it is used only briefly
Except for signaling that you have just arrived
%1$d. When other drivers flash their headlights at you it means
That there is a radar speed trap ahead
That they are giving way to you
That they are warning you of their presence
That there is something wrong with your vehicle
%1$d. While driving, a warning light on your vehicle\'s instrument panel comes on. You should
Continue if the engine sounds alright
Hope that it is just a temporary electrical fault
Deal with the problem when there is more time
Check out the problem quickly and safely
%1$d. Which of these must be in good working order for your car to be roadworthy?
For viewing the traffic approaching from behind
For keeping an eye on the passengers on the rear seat
A hazard as it causes distraction
%1$d. Hand brake is to be used to?
%1$d. The most effective device for protecting passengers during accident is
%1$d. You borrow a friend\'s car and find that the position of the driver\'s seat puts you sitting a long way from the steering wheel and controls. What should you do?
You should never borrow another person\'s vehicle.
You should not adjust another person\'s seat
Adjust the seat forward to fit you
Ask your friend for a cushion to place behind your back.
%1$d. Mirrors are often slightly curved (convex), so that
They give a wider field of vision
They make it easier to judge the speed of following traffic
They make following traffic look bigger
%1$d. What should be the colour scheme for number plates for private vehicles?
%1$d. You have a valid learner\'s licence to drive a car, you are allowed to
Practice driving on roads that have very little traffic
Drive at any time, any place
Drive at any time, and any place provided there is a permanent licence holder with you who can control the vehicle in case of emergency
%1$d. If you have a valid driving licence for a light motor vehicle, what are you allowed to drive?
%1$d. If you meet with an accident while driving a vehicle, without a valid driving licence, the insurance company will
%1$d. While driving on the road without a valid driving licence, when can you face a penal action?
Only when you have met with an accident
When checking officer check your vehicle
Will not face a penal action
%1$d. Minimum age to obtain a car driving licence is?
%1$d. Your car is involved in an accident hurting people, you should
Report to the nearest police station and take the persons to the hospital
Need not report to the police station
Need not report to the police station but should take the persons to the hospital.
%1$d. Is it an offence to obstruct clear vision of your number plates?
Depends on the type of obstruction
No, you are allowed to cover your number plates if you want to.
Yes, but is legal for a towbar or bicycle rack to cover the rear number plate.
%1$d. Are you allowed to use a hand- held mobile phone while driving a car?
Yes, but only when you stop at intersections.
Yes, but you must hold the steering wheel with at least one hand.
%1$d. Which of the following is a basic step to take after an accident?
%1$d. What phone number will you dial in case of a medical emergency to get assistance by the ambulance?
%1$d. You arrive at the scene of an accident. What is the first thing you should do?
Due to the negligence of drivers.
Because of difficult road & climatic conditions
%1$d. The age group of drivers mostly involved in a road accident?
%1$d. An older person\'s driving ability could be affected because they may be unable to
%1$d. You should not use a mobile phone while driving
Until you are satisfied that no other traffic is near
Unless you are able to drive one handed
Because it might distract your attention from the road ahead.
Because reception ispoor when the engine is running
%1$d. You are taking drugs that are likely to affect your driving. What should you do?
Limit your driving to essential journeys
Only drive if accompanied by a permanent licence holder
%1$d. You have been involved in an argument before starting your journey. This has made you feel angry. You should
Start to drive, but open a window
Drive slower than normal and turn your radio on
Have an alcoholic drink to help you relax before driving
Calm down before you start to drive.
%1$d. A driver\'s behaviour has upset you. It may help if you
Gesture to them with your hand
Follow their car, flashing the headlights
%1$d. A motor driving licence issued in any state of india
Is valid through out the india
Is valid only in the state
%1$d. What should you use your horn for?
To alert others of your presence
To allow you right of way
%1$d. Before driving a new vehicle the driver should
Be familiar with the position of controls
Take a bath and make himself fit for driving.
%1$d. The first thing that alcohol affects is
%1$d. You have to drive in the evening. You are invited to a lunch . What is your best course of action?
Dont drink any alcohol at all
Have some milk before drinking alcohol
Eat a hot meal with your alcoholic drinks
%1$d. What advice should you give to a driver who has had a few alcoholic drinks at a party?
Have a strong cup of coffee and then drive home
Wait for a short while and then drive home.
%1$d. What else can seriously affect your concentration, other than alcoholic drinks?
%1$d. Do you have any responsibility when opening a vehicle door on a roadway?
The driver may open his door when ever he wishes to.
No, any following traffic must stop if the door interferes with progress.
No, there is no regulation to cover this situation.
Yes, you must not open a door if you are likely to cause danger to road users or impede traffic.
%1$d. Generally, if you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle you should
Let the emergency vehicle pass and follow it closely behind.
Pull over to the left until the emergency vehicle passes.
%1$d. You arrive at the scene of a motorcycle accident. No other vehicle is involved. The rider is unconscious, lying in the middle of the road. The first thing you should do is to
Move the rider out of the road.
%1$d. Which of the following attitudes are most likely to make you a safe driver?
When i drive, i am responsible for my safety as well as the safety of other road users.
Crashing or not crashing is a matter of luck
Other road users must ensure their safety
Other drivers are rash, i am safety conscious.
%1$d. Your vehicle has broken down on a highway, what is the first thing you should do?
Stop the following traffic and ask for help
Attempt to repair your vehicle quickly
Place a warning triangle on the road.
%1$d. Which of the following should not be kept in your vehicle?
%1$d. Which of the following is true
The pedestrians have the right of way at all pedestrian crossings
Pedestrians have no right to cross the road
Pedestrians shall allow the vehicles to pass
Pedestrians shall move slowly at road crossings
%1$d. What is the maximum speed limit when towing another mechanically disabled vehicle
%1$d. Which of the following is correct
You should not sound horn in silence zones
You should not use multi toned horns
You should not drive a vehicle creating undue noise
%1$d. When you approach a road where workers are undertaking repairs, your speed shall not be more than
%1$d. What shall be your maximum speed when you are passing a procession or meetings on the road
%1$d. A driver of goods vehicle can carry passengers
On the body of the vehicle
%1$d. Which of the following documents need not be carried while driving the vehicle
%1$d. Which of the following are authorised to ask you for production of documents while you are driving on the road
Officers of police department in uniform
Officers of transport department in uniform
Any other officer authorised by government
%1$d. What is the maximum speed with which you are allowed to drive a two wheeler on the road
%1$d. Stopping with the help of gears can be achieved by
%1$d. Which of the following may cause loss of concentration while driving?
%1$d. On a long motorway journey boredom can cause you to feel sleepy. You should
Leave the motorway and find a safe place to stop and ensure a supply of fresh air into your vehicle
Keep looking around at the surrounding landscape
Drive faster to complete your journey sooner
Stop on the hard shoulder for a rest
%1$d. Which of these does the law require you to keep in good condition?
%1$d. You are carrying two 13 year old children and their parents in your car. Who is responsible for seeing that the children wear seat belts?
%1$d. A driver does something that upsets you. You should
Let them know how you feel
%1$d. How should you react to drivers who appear to be inexperienced?
Sound your horn to warn them of your presence
Be patient and prepared for their slow reaction
Flash your headlights to indicate that it is safe for them to proceed
Overtake them as soon as possible
%1$d. You should only flash your headlights at other road users
To show that you are giving way
To show that you are about to turn
To tell them that you have right of way
To let them know that you are there
%1$d. Pressing the clutch pedal down or rolling in neutral for too long while driving will
%1$d. How can you use the gears of your vehicle to control your speed?
By changing to a lower gear
By changing to a higher gear
%1$d. You are driving down a steep hill. Why could keeping the clutch down or selecting neutral for too long be dangerous?
Your vehicle will pick up speed
It will wear tyres out more quickly
%1$d. You are travelling in very heavy rain. Your overall stopping distance is likely to
Be up to ten times greater
%1$d. What is the legal minimum insurance cover you must have to drive on public roads?
%1$d. You have just bought a second hand vehicle. When should you tell the licensing authority of change of ownership?
%1$d. You are the first to arrive at the scene of an accident. Which of these should you do?
Move uninjured people away from the vehicle(s)
%1$d. An accident has just happened. An injured person is lying on the busy road. What is the first thing you should do?
Place him in the recovery position
Make sure that the injured person is kept warm
%1$d. You have stopped at the scene of an accident to give help. Which of these things should you do?
Keep injured people warm and comfortable
Keep injured people calm by talking to them reassuringly
Make sure that injured people are not left alone
%1$d. Your indicators may be difficult to see in bright sunlight. What should you do?
Give an arm signal as well as use your indicators
Touch the brake several time to show the stop lights
Turn as quickly as you can
%1$d. What are the documents you need to carry with you in your vehicle always while driving?
Driving licence, certificate of insurance, registration certificate and pollution under control certificate
No need to carry these documents since they can be stolen or misplaced
%1$d. What is the validity period of a learner\'s licence?
%1$d. What is the grace period for the renewal of a permanent driving licence?
%1$d. Under what circumstances can your vehicle be impounded?
When driving a vehicle without registration
When registration numbers are written in incorrect size dimensions
When registration plate has a wrong colour background
%1$d. How does alcohol affect your driving?
%1$d. What does the law require with regard to the negotiating of uncontrolled pedestrian crossing?
Speed up but avoid hitting pedestrians who are already on the pedestrian crossing
Stop and give precedence to pedestrians who are already on the pedestrian crossing
Speed up keeping in mind pedestrians who are already on the pedestrian crossing
%1$d. What should you do when you are dazzled by headlights of other vehicles at night?
Slow down or stop, if necessary
Look to the left side of the road and slow down. Keep headlights on low beam
%1$d. A cover note is a document issued before you receive your
%1$d. When you smell or see fire in your vehicle, what should you do?
Pull to the side of the road immediately, turn off the engine and all electrical switches and try to smoother burning wires with sand or heavy cloth.
Pull to the side of the road immediately, turn off the engine and all electrical switches and smother burning wires by pouring water on them.
Don\'t do anything but call the fire brigade.
%1$d. You should not drive with your foot on the clutch for longer than necessary because it
Reduces control over the vehicle and will result in premature clutch failure
Reduces the grip of the tyres
Enrich fuel in the air-fuel mixture
Enrich air in the air-fuel mixture
Enrich fuel in the air- water-fuel mixture
%1$d. You have third party insurance. What does this cover?
%1$d. What is the main reason that your stopping distance increases after heavy rain?
You are not able to see large puddles.
The brakes are cold because they\'re wet.
Your tyres have less grip on the road.
Water on the windscreen blurs your view of the road ahead.

%1$d. You see a pedestrian carrying a white stick. This shows that the person is
%1$d. While driving, you approach road works. You see a temporary maximum speed limit sign. You must
Comply with the sign during the working day
Comply with the sign at all times
Comply with the sign when the lanes are narrow
Comply with the sign during the hours of darkness.
%1$d. The driver of a four wheeler must ensure that any load that is carried on a roof rack must be
%1$d. Why passing a lorry is more risky than passing a car?
The brakes of lorries are not as good
%1$d. Before starting the vehicle the driver should check-
If the no. Plates are clean
Tyre condition, pressure & wheel nut for proper tightening.
Leakage of fuel, coolant or oil.
%1$d. Which is illegal while driving a four wheeler vehicle?
Improper working of all lights & indicators.
%1$d. While driving you should always keep the following in mind-
%1$d. When you are being overtaken or passed by another vehicle. Do not
%1$d. Who is responsible for ensuring that the vehicle is not overloaded?
%1$d. On a foggy day you have to unavoidably park your vehicle on the road. What should you do?
%1$d. You should use a mobile telephone only when you
Have stopped at a safe place
%1$d. Turbulence is created by large vehicles travelling at speed. This is most likely to be a danger to
%1$d. You are driving in heavy rain. Your steering suddenly becomes very light. You should
Steer towards the side of the road
%1$d. You are following a large lorry on a wet road. Spray makes it difficult to see. You should
Drop back until you can see better
Put your headlights on full beam
Keep close to the lorry, away from the spray
%1$d. You are driving in fog. Why should you keep well back from the vehicle in front?
In case it changes direction suddenly
In case it’s fog lights dazzle you
In case its brake lights dazzle you
%1$d. You arrive at an accident where someone is suffering from severe burns. Which of the following would help?
Douse the burns with cold water
Remove anything stuck to the burns
Burst blisters that form on the burns
%1$d. What will happen if the wheels are not properly balanced?
%1$d. What is meant by clutch riding?
Keeping your foot on the clutch while driving
Not using the clutch while changing gear
Keeping your foot off the clutch while driving
%1$d. There is vibration on your steering wheel as you drive. What is the probable cause?
%1$d. When may a driver lend his driving licence to another person?
If the person is well known to him.
%1$d. If your vehicle hits a pedestrian you should
Help the person and call an ambulance.
Help the injured person, identify yourself and then report to the police.
%1$d. Stickers, posters and other non- official items may not be placed on the windshield of an automobile because:-
It is unlawful to advertise in this way.
%1$d. A person having driving licence suspended or cancelled may
Drive only when a valid driving licence holder is with him.
%1$d. If a person\'s driving licence validity period is over, he can apply for renewal of motor driving licence within without penalty
Maximum 3 licences at a time, one for each class.
Any number of licences however each licence must authorise only one class of motor vehicle for driving.
%1$d. Lending of a motor vehicle to a person for driving, who is not holding a valid licence is:-
Not an offence since the borrower is solely responsible.
An offence only when vehicle is involved in an accident.
%1$d. Driving a vehicle having pollution values above the limit specified by the law: -
Is liable for a strict warning from authorities.
%1$d. Fitment of a multitoned horn to a motor vehicle: -
Is an offence under the law as it causes noise pollution.
Is liable for a strict warning from authorities.
%1$d. The aim of first aid is
To prevent worsening of victim\'s condition
%1$d. Increasing your speed has what effect on stopping distance?
The more the speed the lesser the stopping distance
The more the speed the more the stopping distance
%1$d. While starting the vehicle which of the following things should be done
%1$d. The right of way should be given to
%1$d. Boarding and alighting while the vehicle is in motion
Is prohibited for all types of vehicles
%1$d. More than two persons on a two wheeler is
Allowed when traffic density is low
%1$d. Using unregistered vehicle in public places is
Gives you a better fuel average
Does not give you sufficient time to react to hazards
Take less time for your journey
Will cause less damage to your engine
%1$d. A basic rule when on highways is
Use the lane that has least traffic
Keep the left lane unless overtaking
Overtake on the side that is clearest
Try to keep above 50 kmph to prevent congestion
%1$d. Causes of the automobile pollution is / are
%1$d. Which of the following will affect your stopping distance
%1$d. To reduce the volume of traffic on the roads you could
Walk or cycle on short journeys
%1$d. To prevent polluting the environment, you can help by
Making sure your tyres are correctly inflated
Not over driving in lower gears
%1$d. A properly serviced vehicle will give
You a refund on your road tax
Better fuel economy and cleaner exhaust emissions
